intro: Wilbrandia hibiscoides var. parvifolia, commonly known as the small-flowered wilbrandia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and heart-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its small, white or pale yellow flowers are typically clustered in axillary inflorescences. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests.
